intro: Androsace lactea f. longiseta, commonly known as the long-stemmed alpine bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
